excerpt: This scenic road features an observation area for views of mountains & several pillar-shaped rocks.
detail_description: Pillar Rocks Rd in Kodaikanal, Tamil Nadu offers a scenic drive with an observation area providing stunning views of mountains and pillar-shaped rocks. The mist-covered cylindrical boulders create a breathtaking sight, while the area is steeped in the love story of David Gelli and his wife. Visitors can enjoy picnicking in the mini garden nestled under the shadow of these majestic pillars. Additionally, there are caverns known as the Devils Kitchen wedged between the rock pillars.
name: Pillar Rocks Rd
address: Tamil Nadu 624101, India

excerpt: Small waterfall, active during the rainy season, reached by a short, forested hiking trail.
detail_description: Bear Shola Falls is a small yet picturesque waterfall in Kodaikanal, surrounded by lush greenery and reached by a short forested hiking trail. It's an ideal spot for a peaceful retreat, offering visitors the chance to reconnect with nature and unwind in a serene setting. The falls are most impressive during the rainy season when the cascading water creates a soothing atmosphere. The name 'Bear Shola' originates from the bears that used to visit the falls for water.
name: Bear Shola Falls
address: Kodaikanal, Tamil Nadu 624103, India

excerpt: This 1936 Hindu temple dedicated to Lord Murugan is set in scenic surrounds with Kurinji flowers.
detail_description: Kurinji Andavar Temple, a vibrant Hindu temple dedicated to Lord Murugan, is located in the picturesque surroundings of Kodaikanal. Built in 1936 by a European lady who embraced Hinduism and changed her name to Leelavathi, this unique site is adorned with colorful Kurinji flowers that bloom once every 12 years. The temple attracts not only devotees but also travelers due to its fascinating history and the annual summer festival celebrated on its grounds.
name: Kurinji Andavar Temple
address: Kurinji Andavar Temple Road, Kodaikanal, Tamil Nadu 624101, India

excerpt: This artificial lake created in the 19th century features a boathouse with rowboats & pedal boats.
detail_description: Kodaikanal Lake, an artificial lake dating back to the 19th century, is a picturesque spot featuring a boathouse offering rowboats and pedal boats for visitors to enjoy. The area around the lake offers serene views and natural light, with lush greenery adding to its charm. While staying at nearby accommodations like Sterling Kodai Lake, guests can experience courteous staff and indoor recreational facilities. The location provides a quiet and secluded atmosphere, perfect for relaxation.
name: Kodaikanal Lake
address: Kodaikanal, Tamil Nadu 624101

excerpt: Viewpoint that offers a wonderful view of the plains, the hills & the 5000 foot drop valley below.
detail_description: Green Valley View Point, also known as Suicide Point, offers a breathtaking view of the plains and a 4,900-foot sheer drop. The drive to this viewpoint includes stops at Moir Point, Pine Forest for picnics, Guna Cave (only accessible for viewing), and Pillar Rocks with its stunning vertical boulders. Some viewpoints require additional walking or climbing uneven steps. Despite its reputation as a suicide spot, it now attracts tourists who come to admire the scenery.
name: Green Valley View Point
address: Kodaikanal, Tamil Nadu 624101, India

excerpt: Discovered in 1821, this popular cave site exists between 3 massive, pillar-shaped rocks.
detail_description: Guna Cave, also known as Devil's Kitchen, is a popular natural attraction discovered in 1821. It is nestled between three massive pillar-shaped rocks and offers a unique adventure for visitors. The area also features the Silver Cascade Waterfall, providing a mesmerizing sight for children to enjoy. Despite being covered with steel mesh, the cave's mysterious rock formations and winding passages continue to captivate adventurers.
name: Guna Cave
address: Pillar Rocks Rd, Kodaikanal, Tamil Nadu 624101, India

excerpt: Constructed in 1872, this 1-km. paved pedestrian path offers an observation area & panoramic views.
detail_description: Coakers Walk, established in 1872, is a 1-km paved pedestrian path that provides stunning panoramic views of Kodaikanal's natural beauty. This attraction offers breathtaking vistas of Berijam Lake, Bryant Park, Kurinjiandavar Temple, and other scenic spots. Nestled in the Tamil Nadu mountains, this man-made walking plaza is an ideal location for leisurely strolls while immersing oneself in the tranquility of nature.
name: Coakers Walk
address: 6FHV+XGC, Coakers Walk, Kodaikanal, Tamil Nadu 624101, India

excerpt: Forest known for its dramatic tall pines, popular for horse-riding, walking & photography.
detail_description: Pine Forest is a picturesque destination featuring tall pine trees, making it a popular spot for activities like horse-riding, leisurely walks, and photography. The area is part of a scenic 2-2.5-hour drive that includes various attractions such as Moir Point, Guna Cave (famous from a movie), Pillar Rocks offering stunning views, and Green Valley View Point providing panoramic vistas.
name: Pine Forest
address: 6F75+FG4, Lake Rd, Berijam, Kodaikanal, Tamil Nadu 624101, India

excerpt: Built in 1872 by Lieutenant Coaker, this long walkway offers scenic views of the valley & mountains.
detail_description: Coaker's Walk, constructed in 1872 by Lieutenant Coaker, is a popular one-kilometer long walkway offering stunning views of the valley and mountains. It is located just 500 meters away from Kodai Lake and provides an amphitheatrical view of the surrounding hill range. The walkway winds around Mount Nebo, starting near Van Allen Hospital and ending at St. Peter's Church, providing panoramic vistas of the plains.
name: Coaker's Walk
address: Kodaikanal, Tamil Nadu 624101, India

excerpt: Solar observatory & museum featuring high-powered telescopes, a library & educational programs.
detail_description: Nestled in the scenic Palani Hills, the Kodaikanal Solar Observatory Museum is a fascinating destination for anyone intrigued by astronomy. This remarkable facility is designed to facilitate detailed studies of solar phenomena, making it an ideal spot for professionals seeking precise cosmic observations. The observatory operates during daylight hours, ensuring minimal disturbances while observing the sun's activities. It also boasts an extensive library filled with invaluable data and hosts numerous national and international conferences throughout the year.
name: Kodaikanal Solar Observatory Museum
address: 6FJ8+V5C, Observatory Rd, near Govt Rose Garden, Kodaikanal, Tamil Nadu 624103, India

excerpt: Roadside 180-ft. waterfall, with its source in lake waters, offering a bridge viewpoint.
detail_description: This falls is located in the hills near Kodaikanal and gets its water from Kodai Lake. The waterfall has a height of 180 meters, making it an attractive tourist spot. The falls can be seen from the roadside, and is a great place to take a dip if the weather is nice.
name: Silver Cascade Waterfall
address: Adukkam, Tamil Nadu 624101, India

detail_description: Silver Cascade Falls is a captivating natural wonder that serves as the welcoming attraction to Kodaikanal on the Madurai-Kodai road. This picturesque waterfall, standing at over 180 feet high, offers a mesmerizing experience with its bubbling waters cascading over rocks. Located just 8 kilometers from Kodaikanal's main town, it is easily accessible and requires no walking or trekking.
name: Silver cascade falls
address: 6GR6+P87, Adukkam, Tamil Nadu 624101, India

excerpt: Outdoor retreat offering landscaped lawns with trees & flowers, plus a children's playground.
detail_description: Chettiar Park in Kodaikanal is a serene outdoor retreat managed by the township, offering beautifully landscaped lawns adorned with colorful flowers and well-kept trees. The park is a favorite among nature lovers and photography enthusiasts, boasting a variety of flora including the rare Kurinji Flowers that bloom once every 12 years, creating a stunning display of purple hues. Visitors can also enjoy the peaceful ambiance while strolling through the park or letting children play in the playground.
name: Chettiar Park
address: 7F2X+GF7, Chettiar Park Rd, Kodaikanal, Tamil Nadu 678242, India

excerpt: Seasonal waterfall caused by overflow from a reservoir with an observation bridge & leafy surrounds.
detail_description: Fairy Falls, also known as the Grand Cascade, is a seasonal waterfall located about 4 km from Kodaikanal Bus Station. It is formed by the overflow from a reservoir and can be reached by following a steep and slippery path behind the Pambar house. The falls offer a picturesque setting with an observation bridge and leafy surroundings, making it an ideal spot for nature lovers to unwind and observe. Visitors can enjoy picnics and various activities at the falls.
name: Fairy Falls
address: 6FF8+FQH, Fairy Falls Rd, Kodaikanal, Tamil Nadu 624101, India

detail_description: Vattakanal is a charming destination with a cafe called Altafs that offers a menu influenced by Mediterranean cuisine, making it popular among tourists from that region. Visitors can enjoy a leisurely walk to Dolphins Nose and then return to the cafe for a satisfying meal. Additionally, the area is home to the luxurious Carlton Kodaikanal resort, which boasts lakeside views and top-notch amenities such as a sauna, massage center, multiple dining options, and a picturesque bar.
name: Vattakanal
address: Kodaikanal, Tamil Nadu 624101, India

detail_description: Pambar Water Falls, also called the 'Grand Cascade', is located about 4 km from Kodaikanal Bus Station. The falls are created by the town reservoir flowing southward and forming Fairy Falls, which then merges with the Vaigai River. Accessible via a steep and slippery path behind Pambar house, visitors can witness a zig-zag stream cascading down Pambar Ravine, tumbling over slick rocks along its winding route.
name: Pambar Water Falls
address: 6FCF+GWW, Kodaikanal, Tamil Nadu 624101, India

detail_description: Upper Lake View Point in Kodaikanal offers a stunning panoramic view of the town and the star-shaped Kodaikanal Lake. It's a favorite spot for photographers and nature enthusiasts, providing an opportunity to witness the beauty of the lake and its surroundings. Visitors can also enjoy activities like boating, cycling, and horse riding nearby. While it can get crowded at times, spending a few minutes here is definitely worth it for the breathtaking views.
name: Upper Lake View Point
address: Kodaikanal, Tamil Nadu 624103

excerpt: Kodaikanal is a hill town in the southern Indian state of Tamil Nadu. Itâ€™s set in an area of granite cliffs, forested valleys, lakes, waterfalls and grassy hills. At 2,000 meters above sea level, the town centers around man-made, star-shaped Kodaikanal Lake, bordered by evergreen forest. Rowing boats can be hired, and hikers and cyclists follow the 5k Lake Road path around the shore.
detail_description: Kodaikanal, often referred to as the Princess of Hill Stations, is a charming hill town located in Tamil Nadu, India. Situated amidst granite cliffs and lush valleys, this picturesque destination offers a serene retreat with its lakes, waterfalls, and verdant hills. The star-shaped Kodaikanal Lake is a prominent feature around which the town revolves. Visitors can partake in activities such as boating on the lake and exploring the 5-kilometer Lake Road path.
name: Kodaikanal
address: Tamil Nadu, India

name: Saleth Matha Church
address: 6FFP+C59, Kodaikanal, Tamil Nadu 624101, India

excerpt: Museum featuring simple wax likenesses of well-known Indian & international personalities.
detail_description: The Wax Museum in Kodaikanal, India is a unique attraction that showcases wax figures of famous personalities from India and around the world. Located near the picturesque Green Valley, this compact museum features exhibits ranging from religious scenes to globally recognized figures. Visitors can admire wax statues of Indian saints, notable historical figures, musicians, and even infamous personalities like Veerappan.
name: Wax Museum
address: 6F9H+345, Republic of, Golf Links Road, Kodaikanal, Tamil Nadu 624101, India

detail_description: The Kodai Chocolate Factory, established in 1999, has become a master in creating delectable homemade chocolates. Visitors can enjoy a wide array of chocolates, as well as spices, alcohol-free wines, and various tea powders. The factory offers affordable prices and the opportunity to witness chocolate production from a distance. It's an ideal destination for those with a sweet tooth or anyone seeking diverse treats and unique gifts to bring home from their travels.
name: Kodai Chocolate Factory
address: Pambarpuram, Golf Club road, Kodaikanal, Tamil Nadu 624101, India

excerpt: Recreation area featuring walking/cycling paths around a manmade lake with small boat rentals.
detail_description: Bryant Park, located in the picturesque hill station of Kodaikanal, is a 20-acre botanical garden established in 1908. Maintained by the Department of Horticulture, it features a glasshouse, lush lawns, colorful flower beds, and a pond with water lilies. The park boasts an extensive collection of rose bushes, cacti, shrubs, and rare tree species.
name: Bryant Park
address: 6FJV+H7W, Lower Shola Rd, Kodaikanal, Tamil Nadu 624101, India

detail_description: Zion Lutheran Church (I.E.L.C) in Kodaikanal is a stunning example of Gothic architecture, built in 1932. The church boasts beautiful stained glass windows, contemporary paintings, and intricate murals depicting scenes from the life of Jesus Christ. It's a must-visit for anyone who appreciates exquisite architectural marvels. Located in Lakshmipuram, this iconic structure showcases the finest elements of Gothic style and is open to all for peaceful prayer during the day.
name: ZION LUTHERAN CHURCH ( I.E.L.C )
address: 6FPR+Q5W, Kodaikanal, Tamil Nadu 624101, India

detail_description: Vattakanal mini falls is a picturesque spot located in the village of Vattakanal, approximately 5 km from Kodaikanal. The falls are nestled amidst lush greenery and offer a magical experience with its white water cascading down into a pool where visitors can swim. Many travelers opt to hike up the waterfall to admire the surrounding beauty. This hidden gem is somewhat secluded from the main road, providing a serene atmosphere with few tourists around.
name: Vattakanal Waterfalls
address: 6FCJ+CP3, Vattakanal, Kodaikanal, Tamil Nadu 624101, India

detail_description: Shenbaganur village is a charming destination where the local community warmly welcomes visitors. The nuns from an orphanage in the area were recently treated to coffee and cream cakes, while the young charges enjoyed pastries and egg puffs. Additionally, a kind gesture was extended to a flustered tourist who had lost his possessions by offering him coffee and sweet buns as he made frantic calls to recover his belongings. This village exudes hospitality and generosity towards all who visit.
name: Shenbaganur
address: Kodaikanal, Tamil Nadu 624101, India

excerpt: High, jutting rock formation shaped like a dolphin's nose offering dramatic valley & mountain views.
detail_description: Dolphin Nose is a prominent rock formation in Kodaikanal that resembles the nose of a dolphin, providing breathtaking views of the surrounding valleys and mountains.
name: Dolphin Nose
address: 6F5P+JVP, Tamil Nadu 624101, India

excerpt: Straightforward overlook point offering panoramic vistas of the greenery & lake below.
detail_description: Upper Lake View is a popular tourist spot in Kodaikanal, located about 3.2 km from Coakers Walk. It offers a stunning panoramic view of the star-shaped Kodaikanal Lake and the lush green surroundings. The overlook point provides an excellent vantage point to admire the natural beauty of the area.
name: Upper Lake View
address: 6FJG+45X, Upper Lake Rd, Kodaikanal, Tamil Nadu 624103, India

detail_description: CSI Christ the King Church in Kodaikanal is a stunning Gothic-style church with an elaborate bell tower and rose window. It's one of the oldest churches in town, along with St. Peter's Church and La Salette Church. A leisurely walk from the church leads to Vattakanal, passing by Pambar Falls, also known as Liril Falls due to its iconic advertisement shoot.
name: CSI Christ the King Church Kodaikanal
address: Club Rd, Kodaikanal, Tamil Nadu 624101, India

excerpt: Century-old golf course with a range of amenities, such as billiards, a practice net & full bar.
detail_description: Nestled in the Palani Hills at an elevation of about 7000 ft, Kodaikanal Golf Club is a century-old golf course that offers a range of amenities including billiards, a practice net, and a full bar. Initially started with 9 holes and browns putting surfaces in 1895, it was later extended to 18 holes with greens in the early fifties.
name: Kodaikanal Golf Club.
address: Pambarpuram Village, Golf Links Road, Observatory P.O, Kodaikanal, Dindigul, Tamil Nadu 624101, India

excerpt: Bright cafe serving snacks including pizzas, in a dining room with a cheery vibe.
detail_description: Muncheez bistro is a vibrant and cozy cafe located in Kodaikanal, known for its delightful rolls with a variety of fillings that cater to the preferences of young patrons. The menu offers a mix of Indian and Continental cuisine, featuring light meals, main courses, and desserts. In addition to their famous rolls, the bistro also serves freshly baked bread, sandwiches, pizzas, dosas, idlis, biryani and other South Indian specialties.
name: Muncheez kodai
address: Poet Tyagaraja Rd, Kodaikanal, Tamil Nadu 624101, India

excerpt: Pizza & pasta offered in a warm environment with charming, old-school decor & a fireplace.
detail_description: Cloud Street is a charming restaurant in Kodaikanal that offers a warm and inviting atmosphere with old-school decor and a cozy fireplace. The menu features delicious wood-fired pizzas, pasta dishes, and divine cakes for dessert. On weekends, guests can enjoy live music from orthopaedist Arun Kolhatkar, who serenades diners with his irresistible baritone.
name: Cloud Street
address: 1st Floor, Opposite Govt. Tourist Office, P.T. Road, Sunday Market Road, Kodaikanal, Tamil Nadu 624101, India

detail_description: Vattakanal Waterfalls, located just 3 km from Kodaikanal, is a stunning natural attraction known for its rich biodiversity and picturesque surroundings. The falls are nestled amidst lush greenery, hills, and trees, providing a perfect setting for nature enthusiasts to admire the beauty of the area. Visitors can capture memorable moments on the bridge near the falls and explore nearby trekking options at Dolphin Nose point.
name: Vattakanal Waterfalls
address: 6FCJ+CP3, Vattakanal, Kodaikanal, Tamil Nadu 624101, India

name: Pillar Rocks Car Parking
address: 6F58+V92, Pillar Rocks Rd, Tamil Nadu 624101, India

detail_description: Green Valley Viewpoint is one of the most photographed tourist attractions in Kodaikanal. It offers a panoramic view of hills, valleys and plains making it look surreal. You can also see the Vaigai dam from here. However, access to this place is now restricted due to its popularity among tourists.
name: Green Valley Viewpoint
address: 6F6G+C58, Kodaikanal, Tamil Nadu 624001, India

excerpt: Spectacular views of mountain scenery surround diners at this informal Middle Eastern cafe.
detail_description: Altaf's Cafe, situated in Vattakanal just 6km from Kodai town, offers a breathtaking view of the Palani region with its stunning mountain scenery. The casual Middle Eastern cafe provides a laid-back atmosphere with basic furniture and mellow electronic music. The menu features backpacker favorites like hummus, falafels, schnitzel, and Nutella pancakes. Nestled into the hillside, the restaurant has limited seating but guarantees an unforgettable dining experience above the clouds.
name: Altaf's Cafe
address: 6F8M+2RG, Dolphin Nose Road, Vattakanal, Kodaikanal, Tamil Nadu 624101, India

excerpt: Small, stepped waterfall whose flow varies depending on the season.
detail_description: Liril Falls, also known as Phambar Falls, is a small and picturesque stepped waterfall located in Kodaikanal. Its flow varies depending on the season, offering visitors a different experience throughout the year. This popular viewpoint gained fame as the backdrop for the iconic Liril soap advertisement, and it continues to attract tourists seeking its natural beauty. The trek to reach the falls spans about 1.
name: Liril Falls
address: 6FCJ+GQ6, Golf Links Road, Kodaikanal, Tamil Nadu 624101, India

detail_description: Nestled atop a hill, Sacred Heart Church stands as a serene beacon of faith in Kodaikanal. Established in 1866 by Fr. Holy Person Cyr S.J., this historic church was built with the generous donation from a Belgian woman grateful for her daughter's recovery. As one of the oldest churches in the area, it offers breathtaking views that showcase the natural beauty of Kodaikanal.
name: Sacred Heart Church
address: Church Convent Rd, R.C, Kamarajar Rd, Kodaikanal, Tamil Nadu 624101, India

detail_description: Nestled in the picturesque mountains of South India, Kodaikanal Yoga Center is situated amidst lush greenery and cascading waterfalls. This serene retreat is set within a stunning ecological farm, offering a tranquil escape from the hustle and bustle of city life. Whether you're seeking relaxation or adventure, this center provides an ideal base for exploring the natural wonders of Kodaikanal.
name: Kodaikanal Yoga Center
address: 6GRP+GH9, Karuna Farm, Adukkam, Tamil Nadu 624101, India

detail_description: The Cocoa Bean Chocolate factory in Kodaikanal is a must-visit for chocolate enthusiasts and those with a sweet tooth. This renowned shop offers an array of delectable chocolates and confectionery items, perfect for indulging or as thoughtful gifts. The hot chocolate is described as smooth, rich, and comforting, ideal for a cozy evening. However, it's the homemade chocolates that truly stand out, showcasing exceptional craftsmanship and passion in every bite.
name: The Cocoa Bean Chocolate factory kodaikanal
address: Maratha shopping complex, Bazaar Rd, near bus stand, Kodaikanal, Tamil Nadu 624101, India

detail_description: Nestled in the picturesque hills of Kodaikanal, Kodaikanal International School has been a beacon of education since its establishment in 1901. This esteemed institution boasts a vibrant and diverse student body from around the world, creating an enriching cosmopolitan atmosphere. Teachers at KIS enjoy a supportive work environment that fosters autonomy and trust, allowing them to thrive under capable leadership.
name: Kodaikanal International School
address: Seven Roads Junction, Kodaikanal, Tamil Nadu 624101, India

name: Shopping outlets
address: 6FMQ+PXG, Boat Club Rd, Kodaikanal, Tamil Nadu 624101, India

detail_description: Nestled just 3 km from Kodai Lake, Kurinji Andavar Murugan Temple is a renowned tourist spot in Kodaikanal. The temple is famous for the rare Kurinji flower that blooms once every 12 years in the region. Surrounded by other attractions like Dolmen Circle and Kodaikanal Solar Observatory, this ancient temple is definitely a must-visit destination for travelers.
name: Murugan Temple
address: 6FQQ+6MP, Kodaikanal, Tamil Nadu 624101, India

detail_description: New Echo Point is a hidden gem near Dolphin's Nose in Kodaikanal, Tamil Nadu. It offers a stunning and relatively unknown viewpoint that provides an enchanting experience for those who manage to find it. The trek from Dolphin's Nose leads to this picturesque spot, where visitors can enjoy the beauty of nature and the soothing sound of echoing rocks. While the area may be slippery and lacks maintenance, making it essential to tread carefully, the effort is rewarded with breathtaking views.
name: New Echo Point
address: 6F4P+WR, Kodaikanal, Tamil Nadu 624101, India

detail_description: The pine forests in Kodaikanal are a major draw for tourists, offering stunning views and a refreshing atmosphere. Visitors can enjoy picnics, treks, and leisurely nature walks amidst the serene surroundings. The area provides an ideal escape from urban life, allowing visitors to immerse themselves in the beauty of nature. It's a great place for families and friends to spend quality time together while taking in the awe-inspiring sight of the majestic pine trees.
name: Pine forests
address: 6FQQ+6MV, Kodaikanal, Tamil Nadu 624101, India

detail_description: Bear Shola Falls is a seasonal waterfall located in dense forests, boasting diverse flora and fauna. During the monsoon season, the tranquil atmosphere comes alive as water cascades down the hilltop, creating a serene environment away from urban hustle. The name of the falls originates from a local legend that suggests bears used to visit this spot for drinking water.
name: Bear Shola fall
address: 6FRM+6G9, Bear Shola Rd, Kodaikanal, Tamil Nadu 624103, India

excerpt: Discovered in 1821, this popular cave site exists between 3 massive, pillar-shaped rocks.
detail_description: Nestled on the steep southern slope of the Palani Hills, Devils Kitchen is a natural wonder in Kodaikanal. It features Pillar Rocks, three massive rocks standing about 400 ft tall adjacent to each other. Legends suggest that the Pandavas once cooked their meals here during their stay in the area. The site was formerly known for its caverns and visual effect of fog passing through them, resembling a chimney.
name: Guna Cave
address: Pillar Rocks Rd, Kodaikanal, Tamil Nadu 624101, India

excerpt: Prominent, hillside lookout featuring a telescope for viewing the valley, mountains & nearby towns.
detail_description: KMC Telescope House is a popular hillside observatory located at Coaker's Walk, which was built in 1872. The site offers a paved pedestrian path that stretches for about 1 kilometer along the slopes of Kodai, providing stunning views of the valley, mountains, and nearby towns. Visitors can enjoy using the telescope to take in breathtaking panoramic vistas. However, it's important to note that the site may be closed during cloudy or misty conditions.
name: KMC Telescope House
address: 6FHV+XHJ, Kodaikanal, Tamil Nadu 624101, India

detail_description: Vinayagar Temple is one of the religious sites in Kodaikanal, alongside other places of worship like Mariamman Temple and Murugan Temple. The town also boasts two mosques at Ellis Villa and Munjikal, as well as the Sacred Heart Church. In addition to its spiritual attractions, Kodaikanal offers natural beauty with spots like Silent Valley View, Bryant Park, Guna Caves, and Pine Forest.
name: Vinayagar Temple
address: 6GX2+4G4, Kodaikanal, Tamil Nadu 624101, India

detail_description: Mariamman Temple is one of the many religious sites in Kodaikanal, alongside Vinayagar Temple and Murugan Temple. The town also boasts two mosques at Ellis Villa and Munjikal, as well as the Sacred Heart Church. In addition to its spiritual landmarks, Kodaikanal offers attractions like the Kodaikanal Solar Observatory, Silent Valley View, Bryant Park, Guna Caves, and Pine Forest.
name: mariamman temple
address: 6FPJ+VW9, Puthukadu St, Kodaikanal, Tamil Nadu 624103, India

detail_description: Kodaikanal, also known as the 'Princess of Hill Stations,' is a popular tourist destination with its famous man-made Kodai Lake at its center. Visitors can enjoy activities like cycling, boating, horse riding, and leisurely strolls around the lake. The town's verdant hills, cascading waterfalls, and picturesque lakes make it a favorite among tourists throughout the year due to its pleasant weather.
name: Kodaikanal
address: 6FQR+62F, SH 156, Kodaikanal, Tamil Nadu 624101, India
